intro: Trichosporum zollingeri, commonly known as the Zollinger's trichosporum, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy stems, which are typical features of the genus Trichosporum. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories or along stream banks. Its leaves are usually alternate and have a rough texture, while its flowers are often white or pale green. Trichosporum zollingeri plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and nectar for various pollinators.
